item.title: Conference and Community Building
item.description:
Conferences/communities are a great way for everyone to network and learn something new.
the effect of the pandemic on how these events are organized has been interesting.
its made people have to innovate around the organization of events.
there have been some positives out of this as well as some negatives
i have attended three erlang/elixir online conferences(two of my best languages) so far this year and its been interesting
the positives/negatives as well as what the future may bring

Postives

  • you have access to the whole world basically for your event if you do the correct marketing since everyone is/was stuck at home
  • People are more confortable with the idea of having conferences online due to the pandemic
  • People can have access to your event from the comfort of their homes/mobile phones which makes it more convenient
  • They wont have to spend large sums of money travelling to your event destination

Negatives

  • the experience of meeting people in 3d,travelling to a new city,not to mention the fact that most communication happens by body language makes you wonder if the experience could have been better face to face
  • screen fatigue can be very real and having to spend long amounts of time focusing and listening to people talk can be draining this can be solved by taking virtual cofee breaks :) in between talks
    there are some apps also like toucan which have an interesting twist around interactivity and i found their virtual lounge idea quite interesting
  • interactivity in the case of sponsors or people who want to demo their products may be less effective/interactive but this can be debatable depending on the product of course

Conclusion

Well as they say time will tell if online conferences can be made better/more interactive.
We will also see if virtual reality or other tech can make the experience more interactive.
Willl we go back to meeting in person completely after the pandemic becomes bearable or online conferences/learning is here to stay and has a market share
we will see.whats your opinion.give me your thoughts in the comments below
